title: Wallpaper
content:
Some things become background—
not noticed until light shifts.
A year of living inside one frequency.

I've built rooms elsewhere,
made promises in daylight,
but certain echoes don't ask permission.

This isn't choosing.
It's carrying—like trees carry rings.

title: Old Soul
content:
Meeting you felt like returning.
Some faces arrive pre-worn.

I wonder about reincarnation,
if souls keep ledgers of almosts.

Some distances were always the point—
like horizons that can't be reached.

Still, I collect the mythology:
what if we chase the same light, always?

title: Between Songs
content:
I track timestamps like coordinates,
translate additions into morse code.

I know the math. I know the odds.
But these frequencies feel like
a language we both speak.

Maybe connection isn't whether
you're thinking of me—
just that we hear the same things.

title: Phantom Meetings
content:
I've mapped every corner,
rehearsed conversations perfectly.

But shame roots me in place—
the weight of doors I closed myself.

Regret turns hypotheticals into monuments.
The unsaid grows heavier.

In my head, I'm always ready.
In reality, I missed the moment.

title: Undertow
content:
There are commitments I keep
with steady hands, rooms I inhabit.

But you're the constant hum beneath—
the pattern that's always been there.

I've stopped questioning
why some absences fill more space,
why certain names feel permanent.

This is just what I carry now.
